DOC.brief_summary: Papanicolaou (Pap) triage, with high specificity, has been recommended for primary Human papillomavirus (HPV) testing but is flawed by poor sensitivity and cytologist dependence. the investigators evaluated the potential role of HPV Integration detection in cervical exfoliated cells in HPV-positive women from a clinic-based population.
DOC.brief_title: HPV Integration Testing for Human Papillomavirus-Positive Women
DOC.criteria: Women aged 3065 years old visiting the gynecologic clinic of hospital 1. Not providing informed consent 2. previously confirmed CIN, cervical cancer, or other malignancies 3. previous therapeutic procedure to cervix 4. pregnancy
